newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: PM MEETS MAJOR SWEDISH COMPANIES.
newsitem.headline: PM MEETS MAJOR SWEDISH COMPANIES.

text.p: Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius met a delegation of leading Swedish businessmen on Thursday and promised to support investment and trade between the two countries, his press office said.
The representatives included Wallenberg Fund Chairman Peter Wallenberg and representatives from Swedish Investor AB, Ericsson , Telia Group, Nordic Power Invest AB and other major companies.
"We have no excess investment capital and that's why we are ready to give the green light to investments and trade," the prime minister was quoted as saying in a statement.
"We want to work with reliable investors," he added.

Wallenberg was quoted as saying that the aim of the visit was to acquire more information about local industry and the possibility for Swedish companies to create new export markets and invest into electricity production and telecommunications.
Vagnorius told them of the country's new privatisation plans, which involve the selloff of Lithuanian Telecom, two state banks and airline Lithuanian Airlines.
